title: Bash
description: Bash is a Unix shell and command language for interacting with the operating system.

snippets.Variables:
# Define variable
name="John"
age=30

# Use variable
echo $name
echo "Hello $name"
echo "Age: ${age}"

# Environment variable
export PATH="/usr/local/bin:$PATH"
snippets.Conditionals:
# If statement
if [ $age -gt 18 ]; then
    echo "Adult"
elif [ $age -eq 18 ]; then
    echo "Just turned 18"
else
    echo "Minor"
fi

# File tests
if [ -f "file.txt" ]; then
    echo "File exists"
fi
snippets.Loops:
# For loop
for i in {1..5}; do
    echo $i
done

# For each
for file in *.txt; do
    echo $file
done

# While loop
while [ $count -lt 10 ]; do
    echo $count
    ((count++))
done
snippets.File Operations:
# Read file
while IFS= read -r line; do
    echo "$line"
done < file.txt

# Write file
echo "Hello" > file.txt
echo "World" >> file.txt

# Check if file exists
[ -f file.txt ] && echo "Exists"
snippets.Arrays:
# Define array
fruits=("apple" "banana" "orange")

# Access elements
echo ${fruits[0]}
echo ${fruits[@]}  # All elements
echo ${#fruits[@]}  # Length

# Add element
fruits+=("grape")
snippets.Command Substitution:
# Capture output
files=$(ls)
date_str=`date +%Y-%m-%d`

# Use in string
echo "Today is $(date)"

# Arithmetic
result=$((5 + 3))
result=$[5 + 3]
